Sidebar terminal latency (bottom-right pane) - make output feel immediate
description:
**Goal:** Make output feel as immediate as a normal terminal (no 0.5–3s delays).

**Context:**
- Current sidebar PTY read loop is Bubbletea-driven (one read per tick). Even after removing flush debounce + writing immediately to vterm, output still lags because the **read itself** is throttled by the message loop.
- A normal terminal drains the PTY continuously in a dedicated loop.

**Likely fix direction:**
- Replace Bubbletea command-scheduled read with a dedicated goroutine that continuously reads from the PTY and pushes bytes into a channel.
- In Bubbletea Update, run a lightweight tick (e.g. 16ms) to drain the channel and batch VTerm.Write.
- Keep vterm writes on UI thread or guard via mutex; avoid per-message overhead.

**File touchpoints:**
- internal/ui/sidebar/terminal.go

title: Fix terminal flickering during Claude Code output
description:
Terminal flickers during Claude Code streaming output, especially visible in embedded terminals.

## Root Cause
- Bubbletea renders full View() on every message, not batched
- No Synchronized Output mode 2026 support
- Full 3-pane recomposition every frame
- Generates excessive scroll events (Claude Code sees 4,000-6,700/sec)

## Current Mitigation
16ms PTY buffer in internal/ui/center/model.go (lines 430-460) batches output but doesn't prevent View() calls

## Related
- Claude Code issue #769, #1913 (same underlying problem, 700+ upvotes unfixed since March 2025)
- Bubbletea issue #1019 (Windows flickering)

## Proposed Fix
1. Implement Synchronized Output mode 2026 wrapping (CSI ? 2026 h/l)
   - Supported: iTerm2, Kitty, Wezterm, Alacritty 0.13+, Windows Terminal, Ghostty
2. Add dirty tracking to skip unchanged pane renders
3. Reduce render frequency to match flush frequency

## Files
- internal/ui/center/model.go - PTY buffering
- internal/app/app.go - Main View() composition
- internal/vterm/render.go - Terminal output
- cmd/amux/main.go - Bubbletea options
